name: High-Hankle and the Wayward Griffons
tagline: Ancient, tilled land, awash with the sounds of chittering hedgerow birds, clopping hooves, and lowing cattle.

procedural.encounter_notes: Encounters are 2-in-6 likely to be with 1d4 knights (Level 1 knights—DMB) and 1d4 griffon trainers equipped with caged wagons, huge nets, and braces of hares, attempting to capture the wayward griffons established on Monk's Hill.

description: Ancient, tilled land, awash with the sounds of chittering hedgerow birds, clopping hooves, and lowing cattle.

points_of_interest.name: The Town of High-Hankle
points_of_interest.description: High-Hankle, sprawling capital of the High Wold, sits in the south of the hex, amid a patchwork of fields, farms, and thorps. Under the lax rule of the current Baron Hogwarsh, High-Hankle has developed a reputation for revelry, carousing, and debauchery of all kinds.
points_of_interest.interior: Town walls: A hulking sandstone wall girds the inner town. Castle Perigonne: A dizzyingly tall tower that looms at the centre of the town. This is the home of Baron Hogwarsh (p60), ruler of the High Wold.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Baron Hogwarsh rules from Castle Perigonne

points_of_interest.name: Monk's Hill and the Ruined Tower
points_of_interest.description: A broad hill stands in the north of the hex, overlooking Tankards Road. Its summit and sides are clad with dense woodland, wild and untouched save by the locals who venture there to collect firewood. A ruined tower stands atop the hill, lost amid the tangled wood.
points_of_interest.entering: Tower ground floor: Relatively intact, with a solid oaken door hanging off its hinges.
points_of_interest.interior: Tower ground floor: Shrubs, mosses, and creepers have colonised the dank interior. A faint purple glow emanates from a circular shaft in the floor, leading 20′ down to the Accursed Grotto. A stone stair winds up to the upper floors. Tower upper floors: Partially collapsed, overgrown with ivy. The 3 griffons have begun to establish a nest, pushing out errant rubble and mounding up branches and straw. Bones and carcasses of sheep are scattered around.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: 3 griffons have established a nest in the upper floors
special_features: Griffons: Travellers sight 1d3 griffons wheeling in the air above the hill
Capture: Sir Waverly (p152) pays 1,500gp for each griffon safely returned to the Griffonry in High-Hankle

points_of_interest.name: The Accursed Grotto
points_of_interest.description: The shaft from the surface ends in a small cave, which opens into a larger subterranean grotto. At the centre of the grotto sits a dark, 10′-deep pool that emits a slowly pulsing, purple glow. Salt-crusted stalactites ring the cave walls, some of which are carved into the likeness of great, grimacing oxen with a blood-like liquid dripping from their mouths.
points_of_interest.entering: Accessed via the circular shaft in the ruined tower floor, leading 20′ down
points_of_interest.interior: At the centre of the grotto sits a dark, 10′-deep pool that emits a slowly pulsing, purple glow. Salt-crusted stalactites ring the cave walls, some of which are carved into the likeness of great, grimacing oxen with a blood-like liquid dripping from their mouths.
points_of_interest.exploring: Examining the pool: A 4′-high, tarnished metal statue of a man in bishop's robes can be spied at the bottom of the pool. The statue—depicting St Howarth—is solid silver, worth 1,500gp.
special_features: Touching the water: Save Versus Doom or be overcome with blood-lust, ruthlessly attacking allies for 1d6 Turns
Touching the "blood": Save Versus Hold or transform into an ox over the course of 2d6 days. The character can be returned to their normal form by magic of curse removal
secrets: History: Long ago, this was a sacred healing pool associated with St Howarth, who once bathed here. Following Howarth's fall (p68), the pool and grotto became accursed.

items.name: Silver statue of St Howarth
items.description: A 4′-high, tarnished metal statue of a man in bishop's robes depicting St Howarth, solid silver
items.location: At the bottom of the pool in the Accursed Grotto
